data.enText: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

data.chText: 我和他共事达六年之久。
data.enText: I worked with him over a span of six years.

data.chText: 这项工程必须在规定期限内完成。
data.enText: The project must be completed within a specific time span .

data.chText: 幼儿注意力持续时间短。
data.enText: Small children have a short attention span .
a range or variety of sth
Managers have a wide span of control.

data.chText: 这些森林绵延在多个纬度上。
data.enText: These forests cover a broad span of latitudes.
the part of a bridge or an arch between one vertical support and another
The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
the width of sth from one side to the other
The kite has a span of 1.5 metres.
to last all through a period of time or to cover the whole of it
His acting career spanned 55 years.

data.chText: 一家五代人的照片失窃了。
data.enText: Family photos spanning five generations were stolen.

data.chText: 包括（广大地区）；涵盖（多项内容）
data.enText: to include a large area or a lot of things

data.chText: 这次行动涉及九个国家，逮捕了200人。
data.enText: The operation, which spanned nine countries, resulted in 200 arrests.
to stretch right across sth, from one side to the other

data.chText: 架在河上的一系列桥梁
data.enText: a series of bridges spanning the river
spick and span
spic and span
neat and clean

data.chText: 他们家总是收拾得清清爽爽。
data.enText: Their house is always spick and span.
spick and span
spic and span
neat and clean

data.chText: 他们家总是收拾得清清爽爽。
data.enText: Their house is always spick and span.

tr: the act of sitting or standing astride
a structure that allows people or vehicles to cross an obstacle such as a river or canal or railway etc.
the distance or interval between two points
a unit of length based on the width of the expanded human hand (usually taken as 9 inches)
two items of the same kind

example: the job was finished in the span of an hour

tr: to cover or extend over an area or time period
example: Rivers traverse the valley floor", "The parking lot spans 3 acres

value.def: A span is the period of time between two dates or events during which something exists, functions, or happens.

example.ex: The batteries had a life span of six hours...
example.tran: 这些电池的寿命为 6 小时。

example.ex: Gradually the time span between sessions will increase.
example.tran: 会议之间的间隔将逐渐延长。

value.def: Your concentration span or your attention span is the length of time you are able to concentrate on something or be interested in it.

example.ex: His ability to absorb information was astonishing, but his concentration span was short...
example.tran: 他吸收信息的能力令人吃惊，但是他的注意力持续时间很短。

example.ex: Young children have a limited attention span and can't concentrate on one activity for very long.
example.tran: 小孩子的注意力持续时间十分有限，不能长时间地专注于一个活动。

value.def: If something spans a long period of time, it lasts throughout that period of time or relates to that whole period of time.

example.tran: 他的职业生涯持续了 16 年。

example.ex: The film, spanning almost a quarter-century, tells the story of Henry Hill...
example.tran: 这部时间跨度将近四分之一世纪的影片讲述的是亨利·希尔的故事。

example.ex: Lining a corridor is a wall of photographs spanning his rugby days.
example.tran: 走廊的一面墙上贴满了他橄榄球生涯里各个时期的照片。

value.def: If something spans a range of things, all those things are included in it.

example.ex: Bernstein's compositions spanned all aspects of music, from symphonies to musicals.
example.tran: 伯恩斯坦创作的乐曲涉及了从交响乐到音乐剧等音乐的各个方面。

example.ex: ...a remarkable man whose interests spanned almost every aspect of nature.
example.tran: 一个兴趣广泛、几乎涉猎了自然学科所有领域的杰出男性

value.def: The span of something that extends or is spread out sideways is the total width of it from one end to the other.

example.ex: It is a very pretty butterfly, with a 2 inch wing span...
example.tran: 这是一只非常美丽的蝴蝶，翼展 2 英寸。

example.ex: It may be that you are unaware of where your hip joint is; it is not at the waist but a good hand span below it.
example.tran: 这也许是因为你并不晓得髋关节的位置，它不在腰部，而是位于腰部以下一手拃宽处。

value.def: A bridge or other structure that spans something such as a river or a valley stretches right across it.

example.ex: Travellers get from one side to the other by walking across a footbridge that spans a little stream.
example.tran: 游客通过一座横跨小溪的步行桥从一边来到另一边。

example.ex: ...the humped iron bridge spanning the railway...
Architects tell their clients that floors can span 100 metres without any visible means of support.
example.tran: 建筑师告诉他们的客户，在没有任何有形支撑物的情况下，楼板可以延伸 100 米。

trans: (人、动植物的)寿命，预期生命期限；(产品等的)预期使用期限；(组织、想法等的)预期存在期限
跨距长度；跨度；跨径；跨距；跨度距离
大跨度桥梁；长径距牙桥
记忆广度；記憶廣度；加强储存记忆；人的记忆容量；记忆长度
数字广度；数字广度测试；数字记忆；记忆广度；记忆广度测验
